title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2024 about large language models (LLM) hallucination, how to detect them, and how to mitigate them
**"On the Dangers of Stochastic Parrots: Can Language Models Be Too Big?"** by Emily Bender, Timnit Gebru, et al
Discusses the risks of large language models, including hallucination
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom B. Brown et al
Introduces GPT-3 and touches on issues related to hallucination
**"Mitigating Bias and Hallucination in Multimodal Data-to-Text Generation"** by Piji Li et al
Focuses on multimodal data and hallucination mitigation techniques
**"Evaluating and Mitigating Hallucinations in Multimodal Conditional Text Generation"** by Xinting Huang et al
Methods for evaluating and reducing hallucinations in multimodal text generation
**"Faithful to the Original: Fact-Aware Neural Abstractive Summarization"** by Wojciech Kryściński et al
Techniques to ensure factual accuracy in summarization tasks
**"Detecting Hallucinated Content in Conditional Neural Sequence Generation"** by Shashi Narayan et al
Methods for detecting hallucinated content in neural sequence generation
**"Hallucination of Facts in Neural Machine Translation"** by Markus Freitag et al
Examines hallucination in machine translation and proposes mitigation strategies
**"Reducing Hallucination in Neural Machine Translation: A Source Context Encoding Approach"** by Jiatao Gu et al
Discusses source context encoding as a method to reduce hallucinations
**"Improving Factual Consistency and Reducing Hallucination in Dialogue Systems"** by Tiancheng Zhao et al
Focuses on dialogue systems and techniques to improve factual consistency
**"Fact-based Text Editing"** by Yuning Mao et al
Techniques for editing text to ensure factual accuracy
**"Hallucination in Neural Machine Translation: Detection and Mitigation"** by Myle Ott et al
Comprehensive study on hallucination in neural machine translation
**"Faithful and Controllable Text Generation"** by Ximing Lu et al
Methods for generating text that is both faithful to the input and controllable
**"Improving Factual Accuracy in Text Generation with Knowledge Graphs"** by Angela Fan et al
Using knowledge graphs to improve factual accuracy in text generation
**"Towards Faithful Neural Table-to-Text Generation with Content-Matching Constraints"** by Bailin Wang et al
Ensuring faithfulness in table-to-text generation with content-matching constraints
**"Faithful Text Generation with Data Constraints"** by Xinyuan Zhang et al
Methods for generating text that adheres to data constraints to ensure accuracy
**"Detecting Hallucinations in Neural Machine Translation: A Model-Agnostic Approach"** by Yunsu Kim et al
Model-agnostic techniques for detecting hallucinations in machine translation
**"Towards Reducing Hallucination in Neural Machine Translation: A Reinforcement Learning Approach"** by Jinhua Zhu et al
Using reinforcement learning to reduce hallucinations in machine translation

container-title: **"Faithful Neural Machine Translation with Data Augmentation"** by Qi Liu et al

title: Data augmentation techniques to ensure faithful translations
**"Improving the Faithfulness of Abstractive Summarization via Entity Coverage Control"** by Ziqiang Cao et al
Techniques to improve the faithfulness of abstractive summarization
**"Hallucination-Free Neural Machine Translation with Consistency Regularization"** by Rui Wang et al
Consistency regularization methods to prevent hallucinations in machine translation

These articles cover a range of topics related to hallucination in large language models, including detection and mitigation strategies across different applications such as machine translation, text generation, and summarization
